Action.author: admin
Action.body:
I am a project role comment
Now I have been changed

ChangeItem.newstring: This issue is duplicated by MKY-1
I am CF text across many lines
This issue is duplicated by HSP-3

ChangeItem.oldstring: This issue is duplicated by HSP-3

ChangeItem.newstring: Parent values: cascading select1(10020). Level 1 values: cascading select1a(10023).

ChangeItem.oldstring: Parent values: cascading select1(10020). Level 1 values: cascading select1a(10023).
ChangeItem.newstring: Parent values: A(10031). Level 1 values: A2(10034).

FieldConfigScheme.name: Default Issue Type Scheme
FieldConfigScheme.description: Default issue type scheme is the list of global issue types. All newly created issue types will automatically be added to this scheme.

FieldScreen.name: Default Screen
FieldScreen.description: Allows to update all system fields.

FieldScreen.name: Workflow Screen
FieldScreen.description: This screen is used in the workflow and enables you to assign issues

FieldScreen.name: Resolve Issue Screen
FieldScreen.description: Allows to set resolution, change fix versions and assign an issue.

Issue.summary: CLONE -test
Detect currently running instance of Mozilla when app is launched a second time
Option to file replies in folder of original message
mozilla hangs at startup before mapping window -- java stuck?
Implement MDB in terms of an open source database which is more memory-efficient than Mork
*nix only : Window Class the same for all mozilla windows
Full zooming not functional (images, objects as well as text) (page zoom like opera)
Reply, Reply All, Forward, and Next should be dual menubuttons
Movemail on *BSD should use flock(2) for locking mail file
need better UIDs for ICS items
unsupported X selection targets (supported by NS4)
scroll position not preserved in document using JS "new Image" ?
context menu is not context sensitive
Implement backend for cmd_copyImageContents
Browser stores the current URL in a hidden native widget
browser.display.screen_resolution ignored in 1.0.1
[FEATURE] UI: Messaging annotations.
please make history.dat easier to parse (i.e., not Mork)
need option for mailto: to launch external mail app or open a webmail url
substituting non-fixed-width chars inside <PRE>
primary selection never cleared when text deselected
"copy" and "copy link" screwed up
wide-char (kanji) cut-n-paste gives wrong value (non-functional)
A part of the view is shifted 1px to the left when unselecting text
Middleclick on browser content area loads clipboard as URL
debugging and about: options not implemented !
Downloads are stored in $TMPDIR|$TMP|$TEMP|/tmp first and then moved to the selected path only after the download finishes / location is selected
test bs
Not in scheme summary

IssueType.name: Bug
IssueType.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

IssueType.name: New Feature
IssueType.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.

IssueType.name: Task
IssueType.description: A task that needs to be done.

IssueType.name: Improvement
IssueType.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.

IssueTypeScreenScheme.name: Default Issue Type Screen Scheme
IssueTypeScreenScheme.description: The default issue type screen scheme

OSPropertyString.value: For example operating system, software platform and/or hardware specifications (include as appropriate for the issue).

An estimate of how much work remains until this issue will be resolved.
The format of this is ' *w *d *h *m ' (representing weeks, days, hours and minutes - where * can be any number)
Examples: 4d, 5h 30m, 60m and 3w.
This value can not be changed after work has begun on the issue.

PermissionScheme.name: Default Permission Scheme
PermissionScheme.description: This is the default Permission Scheme. Any new projects that are created will be assigned this scheme

Atlassian Gadgets OAuth Service Provider Plugin
Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - OAuth Service Provider SPI
ROME: RSS/Atom syndication and publishing tools
ROME, RSS and atOM utilitiEs for Java
Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Project Config Plugin
Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - View Issue Panels
Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Look And Feel Logo Upload Plugin
Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Closure Template Renderer
Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Admin Quick Navigation
Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - DevMode - Func Test Plugin
Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Admin Summary Component

Priority.name: Blocker
Priority.description: Blocks development and/or testing work, production could not run.

Priority.name: Critical
Priority.description: Crashes, loss of data, severe memory leak.

Priority.name: Minor
Priority.description: Minor loss of function, or other problem where easy workaround is present.

Priority.name: Trivial
Priority.description: Cosmetic problem like misspelt words or misaligned text.

Project.name: homosapien
Project.description: This is the description for project homosapiens. This is a long description so we can see what this will do to the html we are using to display this on the project import, project selection screen.

ProjectRole.name: Users
ProjectRole.description: A project role that represents users in a project

ProjectRole.name: Developers
ProjectRole.description: A project role that represents developers in a project

ProjectRole.name: Administrators
ProjectRole.description: A project role that represents administrators in a project

Resolution.name: Fixed
Resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

Resolution.name: Won't Fix
Resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.

Resolution.name: Duplicate
Resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.

Resolution.name: Incomplete
Resolution.description: The problem is not completely described.

Resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce
Resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.

Status.name: Open
Status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

Status.name: In Progress
Status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

Status.name: Reopened
Status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

Status.name: Resolved
Status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

Status.name: Closed
Status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

Workflow.name: My workflow
Workflow.descriptor: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE workflow PUBLIC "-//OpenSymphony Group//DTD OSWorkflow 2.8//EN" "http://www.opensymphony.com/osworkflow/workflow_2_8.dtd"> <workflow> <meta name="jira.update.author.name">admin</meta> <meta name="jira.updated.date">1210136929742</meta> <meta name="jira.description"></meta> <initial-actions> <action id="1" name="Create Issue"> <meta name="jira.i18n.title">common.forms.create</meta> <validators> <validator name="" type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.PermissionValidator</arg> <arg name="permission">Create Issue</arg> </validator> </validators> <results> <unconditional-result old-status="Finished" status="Open" step="1"> <post-functions> <function type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.IssueCreateFunction</arg> </function> <function type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.IssueReindexFunction</arg> </function> <function type="class"> <arg name="eventTypeId">1</arg> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction</arg> </function> </post-functions> </unconditional-result> </results> </action> </initial-actions> <common-actions> <action id="2" name="Close Issue" view="resolveissue"> <meta name="jira.i18n.title">closeissue.title</meta> <meta name="jira.i18n.submit">closeissue.close</meta> <meta name="jira.i18n.description">closeissue.desc</meta> <restrict-to> <conditions type="AND"> <condition type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.PermissionCondition</arg> <arg name="permission">Resolve Issue</arg> </condition> <condition type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.PermissionCondition</arg> <arg name="permission">Close Issue</arg> </condition> </conditions> </restrict-to> <results> <unconditional-result old-status="Finished" status="Closed" step="6"> <post-functions> <function type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueStatusFunction</arg> </function> <function type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.misc.CreateCommentFunction</arg> </function> <function type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction</arg> </function> </post-functions> </unconditional-result> </results> </action> <action id="4" name="Start Progress"> <meta name="jira.i18n.title">startprogress.title</meta> <restrict-to> <conditions> <condition type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.AllowOnlyAssignee</arg> </condition> </conditions> </restrict-to> <results> <unconditional-result old-status="Finished" status="Underway" name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction</arg> </function> </post-functions> </unconditional-result> </results> </action> <action id="3" name="Reopen Issue" old-status="Finished" status="Reopened" step="5"> <post-functions> <function type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueFieldFunction</arg> <arg Worklog.author: admin
Worklog.body: I am a worklog that has been changed
